intro: Bunchosia pauciflora, commonly known as the little-flowered bunchosia, is a shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Bunchosia pauciflora is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
